Little child, little child
 Little child, won’t you dance with me?

This line was written, like the rest of the song, to be slyly suggestive.

The use of “dance” as a euphemism for sex is fairly well established – see Doctor Who’s “The Doctor Dances” for a prominent example:

Rose: What? Are you telling me you do… dance?
The Doctor: Nine hundred years old, me. I’ve been around a bit. I think you can assume at some point I’ve danced.

Contrast with I’m Happy Just To Dance With You, where dancing is very definitely just dancing.
